Patient 11: A 72-year-old female with a history of congestive heart failure and type 2 diabetes. Her medication regimen includes metformin, lisinopril, and furosemide. She has a documented allergy to penicillin, which causes a rash. Her family history is significant for cardiovascular disease, with both parents having had heart attacks in their 60s. She has experienced previous medication adjustments due to episodes of hypotension.
